alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 2:37PM MST until August 16 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MST/645 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Areas west of Sunrise and Leupp in Coconino County, in north central Arizona. * WHEN...Until 545 PM MST /645 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Ponding of water in poor drainage areas could create hazardous travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 235 PM MST /335 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Little Colorado River and San Francisco Wash. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... areas west of Sunrise and Leupp on the Navajo Reservation. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
